trans-unit.source: Credential assets in Azure Automation | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Credential assets in Azure Automation | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Credential assets in Azure Automation contain security credentials that can be used to authenticate to resources accessed by the runbook.
trans-unit.target: Credential assets in Azure Automation contain security credentials that can be used to authenticate to resources accessed by the runbook.

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to create credential assets and use them in a runbook.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to create credential assets and use them in a runbook.

trans-unit.source: Credential assets in Azure Automation
trans-unit.target: Credential assets in Azure Automation

trans-unit.source: An Automation credential asset holds a [PSCredential](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.management.automation.pscredential) object which contains security credentials such as a username and password.
trans-unit.target: An Automation credential asset holds a [PSCredential](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.management.automation.pscredential) object which contains security credentials such as a username and password.

trans-unit.source: Runbooks may use cmdlets that accept a PSCredential object for authentication, or the runbook may extract the username and password of the PSCredential object to provide to some application or service requiring authentication.
trans-unit.target: Runbooks may use cmdlets that accept a PSCredential object for authentication, or the runbook may extract the username and password of the PSCredential object to provide to some application or service requiring authentication.

trans-unit.source: The properties for a credential are stored securely in Azure Automation and can be accessed in the runbook with the [Get-AutomationPSCredential](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.management.automation.pscredential.aspx) activity.
trans-unit.target: The properties for a credential are stored securely in Azure Automation and can be accessed in the runbook with the [Get-AutomationPSCredential](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.management.automation.pscredential.aspx) activity.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Secure assets in Azure Automation include credentials, certificates, connections, and encrypted variables.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Secure assets in Azure Automation include credentials, certificates, connections, and encrypted variables.

trans-unit.source: These assets are encrypted and stored in the Azure Automation using a unique key that is generated for each automation account.
trans-unit.target: These assets are encrypted and stored in the Azure Automation using a unique key that is generated for each automation account.

trans-unit.source: This key is encrypted by a master certificate and stored in Azure Automation.
trans-unit.target: This key is encrypted by a master certificate and stored in Azure Automation.

trans-unit.source: Before storing a secure asset, the key for the automation account is decrypted using the master certificate and then used to encrypt the asset.
trans-unit.target: Before storing a secure asset, the key for the automation account is decrypted using the master certificate and then used to encrypt the asset.

trans-unit.source: Using a PowerShell credential in a runbook
trans-unit.target: Using a PowerShell credential in a runbook

trans-unit.source: You retrieve a credential asset in a runbook with the **Get-AutomationPSCredential** activity.
trans-unit.target: You retrieve a credential asset in a runbook with the **Get-AutomationPSCredential** activity.

trans-unit.source: This returns a [PSCredential object](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.management.automation.pscredential.aspx) that you can use with an activity or cmdlet that requires a PSCredential parameter.
trans-unit.target: This returns a [PSCredential object](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.management.automation.pscredential.aspx) that you can use with an activity or cmdlet that requires a PSCredential parameter.

trans-unit.source: You can also retrieve the properties of the credential object to use individually.
trans-unit.target: You can also retrieve the properties of the credential object to use individually.

trans-unit.source: The object has a property for the username and the secure password, or you can use the **GetNetworkCredential** method to return a [NetworkCredential](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.net.networkcredential.aspx) object that will provide an unsecured version of the password.
trans-unit.target: The object has a property for the username and the secure password, or you can use the **GetNetworkCredential** method to return a [NetworkCredential](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.net.networkcredential.aspx) object that will provide an unsecured version of the password.
